intro: [WRONG START] Dioscorea wichuraa, commonly known as the Andean yam, is a tuberous plant native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit, with tendrils that allow it to ascend supports. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits. Its tubers are rich in starch and have been traditionally used as a food source by indigenous communities. The botanical features of Dioscorea wichurae make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
